title: Deep Learning-Based Data Utilization Education for Underwater Acoustic Signal Classification

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Programming and Machine Learning Concepts
context.additional_context: Evening/weekend hybrid program for working professionals, combining theoretical lectures with practical sessions and conducting data analysis using personal devices (BYOD)

learning_goals: Learners can explain the physical characteristics of underwater acoustic signals and their classification principles.
Learners can implement a process to augment limited acoustic datasets using Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs).
Learners can design a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) model to achieve 85% or higher accuracy in underwater signal classification.
Learners can comparatively analyze constraints in real-world data acquisition and limitations of deep learning models.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
